column4: I'm trying to use VNC from my ubuntu machine to my windows machine. All I get is "connection closed". It worked before, but nothing's changed. It just... stopped working.
Can anyone help?
1) you want to see your Windows on the Ubuntu Screen?
Yes. And Yes.

something obviously _has_ changed. Perhaps your Ubuntu machine is now offline? Firewall blocking? Perhaps on the Windows machine, the VNC Server crashed/stopped? I prefer to let VNC run in App mode on Windows, not as a service.
don't worry about that PM :-)
Hmm... let's go bottom-up: Please ping the Windows machine and see, if that works
and thechris: Successfully pinged the windows machine.
Restart the windows machine. If possible, uninstall the VNC service, in order for you to be able to start VNC as a normal Application later
Will do, one moment.
you can disable the firewall first for checking
okeydokey
and thechris: Windows machine re-booted, VNC service unregistered, firewall disabled.
now start VNC as app. It is an entry in the start menu... VNC Server USER MODE or so
done.
now use the Ubuntu VNC client again and try to connect
if that does not work, check the settings of your VNC server with right click on the icon in the system tray of the windows machin (bottom right usually)
check by re-activating Windows' firewall
Firewall reactivated, VNC still works, so it wasn't that.

Hmm. Now it's getting harder to find the reason. I'd suggest you be happy for now. If it happens again, you need to find a pattern. Once you can reproduce the "failing", you have a good chance of repairing.
I'm thinking it was the fact I had it registered as a service. That's the only thing that changed, and I've had similar issues in the past.
I can't tell, I never used it as service *smirks*
